Html: Are there any plans to make this into an addon similar to DrDamage for in-game use? I think alot of people would find this very helpful, especially since at least some of DrDamages calculations are off such as frostfire bolt
No. Rawr's calculations cannot viably be done in-game.
i dont mean to include best gear sets calculations just basic damage for each spell, your numbers seem much more accurate and i think it would be very helpful.
No, there are no plans for a Rawr addon.
The only interesting thing I could imagine would be some way to mark upgrades in game so you don't need to alt tab and frustrate the raid leader :-)

Actually AtlasLoot provides a "Wishlist". Everything added to your wishlist is marked with a star in AtlasLoot.

I find upgrades with Rawr and add them to the wishlist in-game. Whenever I need to raid or do a dungeon I just check up to refresh my memory :)
What about addon that grabs all available gear from bags and bank and then saves it in some way Rawr understand?
Rawr supports an import of data from the CharacterProfiler addon.  http://www.rpgoutfitter.com/Addons/CharacterProfiler.cfm

Rawr will also export data from the upgrade list in a format that the addon lootplan can import as well http://wow.curse.com/downloads/wow-addons/details/lootplan.aspx

Lootplan isn't perfect, and the interface to import the upgrade list is a little klunky, but it works.

~Droid
Tried both CharacterProfiler and LootPlan. But I have full bank of different gear and sometimes it's hard to make new Rawr character profile checking every piece of armor for english name.
